Title: Careline Services
Description: Rochdale BC requires a Contractor for the provision of Telecare Monitoring and Response Services.  The Council are looking for one organisation to deliver both monitoring and response as part of its core business, however, consideration will be given to bids from a lead provider, who is working in partnership with the provider of one of the elements of the service.  The partnership must be robust and the lead provider be able to demonstrate the effectiveness of the partnership. Evidence of a formal partnership must be submitted with the tender bid, e.g. signed partnership agreement. Bids will not be accepted for either monitoring or response as separate contracts.

Title: CPU1891 - Telecare Services
Description:
A comprehensive
Telecare Service. This will comprise the call
monitoring of telecare alarms; the 24/7 emergency
response service for telecare alarms and the
installation, assessment and review of telecare and associated equipment. 
The proposed length of contract(s) is 5 years with the
option to extend for a further 2 on a year by year
basis.
Lot 1 - total value £596,988    Lot 2 - total value £4,996,572

Title: 24/7 Call Monitoring Service
Description:
Information technology services. Information technology services. to provide a service and facilities:
— Call handling software to meet Telecare Services Association (TSA) standards
— Ability to identify individual personal and environmental sensor activation
— One dedicated line for emergency calls
— 24/7, all year round call monitoring service
— At least 3 300 connections
— Minimum of 2 x call handlers at any given time
— Appropriate advice, reassurance, response to calls
— Full disaster recovery system in place
— Ability to respond to 100% of all activations within 180 seconds
— Effective emergency out of hours repairs call handling (to include repair diagnostic for priority assessment).

Title: Technology Enabled Care Services Framework (19-23)
Description:
The scope of this Framework Agreement is for the provision of products and services in relation to Technology Enabled Care (TEC) Services for both analogue and digital solutions. The products and services fall into 4 separate Framework 'Lots' reflecting the structure of the industry:
  Lot 1: Product Catalogue;
  Lot 2: Installation, Service/Maintenance and Repair;
  Lot 3:Call Monitoring and Mobile Response.
  - Sub lot 3.1 Call Monitoring,
  - Sub lot 3.2 Mobile Response,
  - Sub lot 3.3 Call Monitoring and Mobile Response,
  - Sub lot 3.4 Call Centre Monitoring Equipment Servicing/Maintenance and Repair.
  Lot 4: Consultancy.

Title: 203_15 Telecare and Telehealth Products and Services
Description:
Supply of telecare and telehealth products and equipment, including mobile services, apps and software. Provision of telecare and telehealth services including service redesign and transformation.
Provision of related support services (including assessment, reporting, training, repair, maintenance, monitoring and response).

As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authority Councils; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies and Local Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; Any Public Body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Full details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 36 months.The total estimated values stated in include the option period.
